bibl.title: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, July 28, 1950

div1.p: Hench inquires if the memorial plaque has been placed on the building where Walter Reed died. Hench regrets that he could not attend Emilie Lawrence Reed's funeral to serve as a pallbearer.

div1.head: Letter from Philip Showalter Hench to J.F. Siler, July 28, 1950
div1.opener:
July 28, 1950
Col. J. F. Siler
9494 94th Place, N. W.
Washington, D. C.
My dear Colonel Siler:
div1.p:
I wonder whether the Memorial Plaque
has yet been erected. I think I wrote you that
I saw it and liked it very much.

I was very sorry indeed that I could not
accept the honor of being pallbearer at Mrs. Reed's
funeral this last Tuesday. I sent messages to the
family and assume that the Walter Reed Memorial
Association did the same.

Please see the enclosed letter. I shall
appreciate your comments.
div1.closer:
Sincerely, P. S. Hench, M. D. PSH/ar
